channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Trump rally at Madison Square Garden: List of street closures
item.description: NYPD tightens security at Madison Square Garden for a Trump and JD Vance rally on Sunday, urging public transit use due to road closures. Interim Police Commissioner Donlon assures safety, with heavy weapons teams and counterterrorism units on standby. Mayor Adams emphasizes zero tolerance for crime during expected protests. Trump aims to rally support ahead of the election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What time is Trump rally at Madison Square Garden in various USA time zones (ET, CT, MT, PT)?
item.description: Donald Trump will host a rally at Madison Square Garden in New York City, nine days before Election Day. The event, a major fundraising effort, aims to boost Republican congressional candidates and features key speakers such as Elon Musk and Rudy Giuliani. Tickets are limited to two per phone number and were available on Trump's campaign website.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'We struck the head of octopus': Netanyahu on Israel's air strike on Iran
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated the recent airstrike on Iran was precise, achieving its objectives. The strike was in retaliation to Iran's missile attack on Israel earlier in October, which was largely intercepted. Netanyahu emphasized Israel's commitment to retaliate decisively against any harm. Iran confirmed limited damage and four soldiers killed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine's air defence downed 41 of 80 Russian drones, military says
item.description: Ukraine's air defences successfully intercepted 41 of 80 Russian drones launched overnight. Although 32 drones remain unaccounted for, there were no reports of casualties or damage to critical infrastructure. President Zelenskiy highlighted Russia's relentless attacks, which included a significant number of guided aerial bombs, attack drones, and missiles over the past week.

item.title: Creative costumes, scary decorations, and more: World gears up for Halloween
Putin says Moscow will respond if West helps Ukraine to strike deep into Russia
item.description: President Putin announced that Russia's defence ministry is evaluating responses to potential US and Nato support for Ukrainian strikes deep into Russia using Western missiles. He regards such actions as a significant escalation, possibly involving Nato's direct participation. The Ukraine war has heightened tensions between Russia and the West.

item.title: More than 120 killed in paramilitary rampage in east-central Sudan, says UN, doctors group
item.description: Rapid Support Forces (RSF) fighters in Sudan wreaked havoc in Gezira province, resulting in over 120 deaths, sexual violence, and mass displacement. Clashes erupted between the RSF and Sudanese military, leading to severe human rights abuses and drawing international condemnation, with calls for immediate intervention.

item.title: 'Should not be exaggerated nor downplayed': Iran's supreme leader says on Israeli strikes, skips retaliation call
item.description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei advised against exaggeration or downplaying of Israel's raids, avoiding direct calls for retaliation. The strikes, resulting in four Iranian casualties, were a response to Iran’s earlier missile attack, raising concerns of regional escalation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taiwan says China holds 'combat' patrol after latest US arms sales
item.description: China conducted joint combat readiness patrols with fighter jets and drones around Taiwan following the US State Department's approval of a $2 billion arms sale to Taipei. Taiwan's defence ministry monitored and responded to the maneuvers. Beijing condemned the arms deal, claiming it threatened China's sovereignty and stability in the region.

item.title: From shit to yummy: Youtuber takes Chinese woman to Indian restaurant to change perception; see video
item.description: An Indian YouTuber, 'Passenger Paramvir,' goes viral for his composed response to a Chinese woman's critique of Indian street food hygiene. He reassures her by showing hygienic practices and treats her to authentic Indian dishes at a reputable restaurant, easing her concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ​Biden calls Trump a 'loser,' accuses him of ignoring union workers
item.description: President Biden, speaking in Pennsylvania, labeled former President Trump as a 'loser' and accused him of being anti-labor, warning that his re-election would jeopardize union benefits. Biden emphasized the election as a contrast between decency and lack of decency, urging support for Vice President Harris. The Trump campaign dismissed Biden’s remarks, asserting Trump's representation of decency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US approves $2 billion arms deal with Taiwan, sparks fury in China
item.description: The US approves a $2 billion arms deal for Taiwan, including advanced air defense systems, sparking protests from Beijing. Taiwan's new president, Lai Ching-te, emphasizes the package's importance for regional stability amidst increased Chinese military activity around the island, involving record numbers of aircraft and naval vessels.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Storm Trami lands in central Vietnam posing flood risks
item.description: Storm Trami has hit central Vietnam, bringing heavy rains and winds up to 88 kph. Authorities warn of potential floods in urban areas from Ha Tinh to Binh Dinh provinces. Four airports, including Danang's international airport, are temporarily closed. The storm follows last month's deadly typhoon Yagi in northern Vietnam.

item.title: Kamala Harris would get us into World War III: Donald Trump
item.description: As the US presidential elections near, Donald Trump accuses Kamala Harris of being incapable of leadership and argues she would lead the US into World War III. Meanwhile, Michelle Obama defends Harris, criticizing a double standard in scrutiny and highlighting Trump's past behavior and legal issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Oil prices likely to fall after Israel shows restraint in strikes on Iran
item.description: Oil prices are predicted to fall as Israel's strike on Iran over the weekend avoided key oil and nuclear sites, ensuring no disruption to energy supplies. Israeli jets targeted missile factories, easing market concerns. Analysts expect a temporary dip in prices, with Brent crude potentially dropping to $74-$75 a barrel.

item.title: Trump or Harris: Who is Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu likely to support?
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu is hopeful for Trump’s return to the presidency, expecting beneficial policies for Israel despite Trump's mixed messages. Analysts suggest a Trump victory would provide Netanyahu greater freedom, contrasting Biden's more critical stance. Meanwhile, Palestinians remain skeptical of both candidates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Uzbekistan set to elect parliament loyal to president
item.description: Uzbekistan holds a parliamentary election with all participating parties supporting President Shavkat Mirziyoyev. Due to the lack of opposition, the new parliament will likely remain loyal to Mirziyoyev. Significant changes include a mixed election system and heightened legislative activity concerning foreign relations, particularly with Russia.

item.title: China vows 'countermeasures' over $2 billion US arms deal with Taiwan
item.description: China has strongly condemned the US's approval of a $2 billion arms sale to Taiwan, promising countermeasures to defend its sovereignty. The Pentagon's package includes an advanced missile system used in Ukraine. China urges the US to halt such actions to maintain peace, while Taiwan asserts its right to defend itself.

item.title: Tropical storm Trami leaves 126 dead or missing amid massive flooding and landslides in Philippines
item.description: Tropical Storm Trami has wreaked havoc in the Philippines, leaving at least 85 dead and 41 missing. President Ferdinand Marcos acknowledged ongoing rescue efforts, especially in flooded and isolated areas. With over 5 million people affected, the government plans a major flood control project to combat the unprecedented climate threats.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Photo of Kamala Harris in McDonald's dress going viral. Is it real?
item.description: ​McDonald's said it is true that no records of Harris' employment exist but this is not an aberration and not a reason to think that she didn't work at a McDonald's. "Though we are not a political brand, we’ve been proud to hear former President Trump’s love for McDonald’s and Vice President Harris’s fond memories working under the Arches. While we and our franchisees don’t have records for all positions dating back to the early ’80s, what makes ‘1 in 8’ so powerful is the shared experience so many Americans have had."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
